   Studies/Accounting double major or combined with any 
teaching subject is also acceptable.  
(viii) EBSU requires NCE/two (2) 'A' level passes in 
Economics, Mathematics or social studies.  
(ix) ABSU requires 'O' level credit pass in English.  
(x) AAUA requires  
(a) two (2) 'A’ level passes in Economics and one (1) 
other relevant subject  
(b) NCE merit in Economics, Business Education and one 
(1) other subject.  
(c) ND credit in Banking and Finance, Economics and 
Accounting.  
(xi)ILORIN Direct Entry; General English at NCE level is not 
acceptable as a replacement for 'O’ level credit pass in 
English Language.  
  
UTME  
(i) UDU accepts 'O' levelpass in Mathematics.  
(ii) EDALV accepts 'O' level pass in English Language.  
(iii) ABSU, JOS and ABU JA accept 'O’ level pass in 
Mathematics but such candidates may be required to 
pass a remedial course in the 1st year.  
(iv) OAU requires 'O’ level credit passes in five (5) subjects 
which must include English Language, Mathematics 
and Economics plus any other two (2) subjects or five 
(5) TC II credit/merit which must include English 
Language, Mathematics and Social Studies.  
(v) BENIN requires any other Social Science subject in 
addition to Economics.  
(vi) EKSU requires two (2) Social Science subjects.  
(vii) TASUED requires five (5) 'O' level credit passes at one 
(1) sitting or six (6) 'O' level credits at two (2) sittings in 
English Language, Mathematics, Economics and  any 
two (2) or three (3) Science or Social Science subjects.  
(viii) UNIOSUN requires 'O' levelor equivalents with credit 
passes in five (5) subjects: English Language,
